gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਣ ਕਾਦਰ ਦੇ ਚਲਿਤ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਬਨਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaaru Banaaiaa.
translation: Diffusing His one vibration (vak, sound), Oaiikar has become manifest in the forms (of the whole creation).

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਰਿ ਧਰਤਿ ਵਿਛੋੜਿ ਕੈ ਵਿਣੁ ਥੰਮਾ ਅਾਕਾਸਿ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anbari Dharati Vichhorhi Kai Vinu Danmaan Aagaasu Rahaaiaa.
translation: Separating earth from sky, the Oankar has sustained sky without the support of any pillar.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਧਰਤੀ ਰਖੀਅਨਿ ਧਰਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਨੀਰੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jal Vichi Dharatee Rakheeani Dharatee Andari Neeru Dharaaiaa.
translation: He placed earth in water and water in the earth.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਠੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਗੁ ਧਰਿ ਅਗੀ ਹੋਂਦੀ ਸੁਫਲੁ ਫਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kaatdai Andari Agi Dhari Agee Hondee Suphalu Phalaaiaa.
translation: Fire was put into wood and fire notwithstanding, the trees laden with beautiful fruits were created.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੋ ਤਿੰਨੇ ਵੈਰੀ ਮੇਲੁ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Tinnay Vairee Mayli Milaaiaa.
translation: Air, water and fire are enemies of one another but He made them meet harmoniously (and created the world).

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਸ ਸਾਤਕ ਤਾਮਸੋ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ੳੁਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raajas Saatak Taamaso Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Oupaaiaa.
translation: He created Brahma, Visnu and Mahes'a who cherish the qualities of action (rajas), sustenance (sattv) and dissolution (tamas).

gurmukhi: ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੁ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Choj Vidaanu Chalitu Varataaiaa ?1?
translation: Accomplisher of wondrous feats, that Lord created the wonderful creation.

gurmukhi: ੨ ੲੀਸ਼ਵਰੀ ਸ਼ਕਤੀ
translation: Divine Power

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਸੂਰਜ ਚੰਦ ਚਰਾਗ ਬਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee Daa Roop Kari Sooraju Chandu Charaagu Balaaiaa.
translation: Siva and Sakti i.e. the supreme element in the form of consciousness and prakrti, the matter containing dynamic power in it were joined to create the world, and sun and moon were made its lamps.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤੀ ਤਾਰੇ ਚਮਕਦੇ ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਦੀਪਕ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raatee Taaray Chamakaday Ghari Ghari Deepak Joti Jagaaiaa.
translation: Shining stars in the night give the look of lamps lit in each house.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜੁ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰੁ ਦਿਹੁ ਤਾਰੇ ਦੀਪਕ ਰੂਪ ਲੁਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sooraju Aykankaaru Dihi Taaray Deepak Roopu Loukaaiaa.
translation: In day time with the rise of one great sun , the stars in the form of lamps go into hiding.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਤੋਲ ਅਤੋਲੁ ਨ ਤੋਲਿ ਤੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Kavaau Vichi Toli Atolu N Toli Tulaaiaa.
translation: His one vibration (vak) contains millions of rivers (of life) and His matchless grandeurs cannot be measured.

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਜਿਸਿ ਪਰਵਦਗਾਰੁ ਅਪਾਰੁ ਅਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aoankaaru Akaaru Jisi Paravadagaaru Apaaru Alaaiaa.
translation: The benevolent sustainer Lord has also manifested His form as Oankar.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਤਿ ਅਗਮ ਹੈ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਨਹ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Abagati Gati Ati Agam Hai Akad Kadaa Nahi Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: His dynamism is latent, unapproachable and His story is ineffable.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਅਾਖਣੁ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨||
transliteration: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhi Sounaaiaa ?2?
translation: The basis of talk about the Lord is simply hearsay (and not the first hand experience).

gurmukhi: ੩ ਰਚਨਾ ਦੀ ਵਚਿੱਤ੍ਰਤਾ
translation: Wonder of creation

gurmukhi: ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਚਾਰ ਜੁਗ ਜਲ ਥਲ ਤਰੁਵਰੁ ਪਰਬਤ ਸਾਜੇ
transliteration: Khaanee Baanee Chaari Joug Jal Dal Taruvaru Parabat Saajay.
translation: Four mines of life, four speeches and four Ages included, the Lord created water, earth, trees, and mountains.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੰਨ ਲੋਅ ਚੌਦਹ ਭਵਣ ਕਰਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ਨਿਵਾਜੇ
transliteration: Tinn Loa Chaudah Bhavan Kari Ikeeh Brahamand Nivaajay.
translation: The one Lord created the three worlds, fourteen spheres and many universes.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਕੁੰਡਾ ਦੀਪ ਸਤ ਨੳੁ ਖੰਡ ਦਹ ਦਿਸਿ ਵਜਣਿ ਵਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chaaray Koundaa Deep Sat Nau Khand Dah Disi Vajani Vaajay.
translation: For Him the musical instruments are being played at in all the ten directions, seven continents and nine divisions of the universe.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸ ੲਿਕਸ ਖਾਣਿ ਵਿਚਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਲਖ ੳੁਪਾਜੇ
transliteration: Ikas Ikas Khaani Vichi Ikeeh Ikeeh Lakh Oupaajay.
translation: From each originating source, twenty-one lacs of creatures have been produced.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤ ੲਿਕਤ ਜੂਨਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੀਅ ਜੰਤੁ ਅਣਗਣਤ ਬਿਰਾਜੇ
transliteration: Ikat Ikat Jooni Vichi Jeea Jantu Anaganat Biraajay.
translation: Then in each species innumerable creatures exist.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪ ਸਰੂਪ ਕਰਿ ਰੰਗ ਬਿਰੰਗ ਤਰੰਗ ਅਗਾਜੇ
transliteration: Roop Anoop Saroop Kari Rang Birang Tarang Agaajay.
translation: Incomparable forms and hues then appearnd in variegated waves (of life).

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣੁ ਪਾਣੀ ਘਰਿ ਨੳੁ ਦਰਵਾਜੇ ||੩||
transliteration: Paounu Paanee Gharu Nau Daravaajay ?3?
translation: Bodies formed by the association of air and water, have nine doors each.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਚਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਵਚਿਤ੍ਰਤਾ
translation: Wonder of creation

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲਾ ਧੳੁਲਾ ਰਤੜਾ ਨੀਲਾ ਪੀਲਾ ਹਰਿਅਾ ਸਾਜੇ
transliteration: Kaalaa Dhaulaa Ratarhaa Neelaa Peelaa Hariaa Saajay.
translation: Black, white, red, blue, yellow and green colours are adorning (the creation).

gurmukhi: ਰਸੁ ਕਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਵਿਸਮਾਦ ਸਾਦੁ ਜੀਭਹੁਂ ਜਾਪ ਨ ਖਾਜ ਅਖਾਜੇ
transliteration: Rasu Kasu Kari Visamaadu Saadu Jeebhahoun Jaap N Khaaj Akhaajay.
translation: Wondrous tastes of edible and inedible objects have been made which are known through the tongue.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਠਾ ਕੳੁੜਾ ਖਟੁ ਤੁਰਸੁ ਫਿਕਾ ਸਾੳੁ ਸਲੂਣਾ ਛਾਜੇ
transliteration: Mitdaa Kaurhaa Khatu Turasu Dhikaa Saau Saloonaa Chhaajay.
translation: These tastes are sweet, bitter, sour, salty and insipid.

gurmukhi: ਗੰਧ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਅਵੇਸ ਕਰਿ ਚੋਅਾ ਚੰਦਨ ਕੇਸਰੁ ਕਾਜੇ
transliteration: Gandh Sougandhi Avaysu Kari Choaa Chandanu Kaysaru Kaajay.
translation: Mixing many fragrances, the camphor, sandal and saffron have been created.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਦੁ ਕਥੂਰੀ ਪਾਨ ਫੁਲੁ ਅੰਬਰੁ ਚੂਰ ਕਪੂਰ ਅੰਦਾਜੇ
transliteration: Maydu Kadooree Paan Phulu Anbaru Choor Kapoor Andaajay.
translation: Others such as musk cat, musk, betel, flowers, incense, camphors etc are also held to be similar.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਸੰਬਾਦ ਬਹੁ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਅਨਹਦ ਗਾਜੇ
transliteration: Raag Naad Sanbaad Bahu Chaudah Vidiaa Anahad Gaajay.
translation: Many are the musical measures, vibrations and dialogues, and through fourteen skills the unstruck melody rings.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਕਰੋੜ ਜਹਾਜੇ ||੪||
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Karorh Jahaajay ?4?
translation: Lacs of rivers are there on which crores of ships ply.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਰਚਨਾ ਵਿਚ ਮਨੁਖ ਦੇਹ ਪਾਰ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
translation: Among the entire creation only human beings attain liberation

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਸਮੁੰਦ ਅਥਾਹ ਕਰਿ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਭਰੇ ਭੰਡਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sat Samound Adaah Kari Ratan Padaarad Bharay Bhandaaraa.
translation: Variegated forms of agricultural products, medicines,clothings and foods have been created on earth.

gurmukhi: ਮਹੀਅਲ ਖੇਤੀ ਅੳੁਖਧੀ ਛਾਦਨ ਭੋਜਨ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਸਥਾਰਾ
transliteration: Maheeal Khaytee Aoukhadhee Chhaadan Bhojan Bahu Bisadaaraa.
translation: Variegated forms of agricultural products, medicines,clothings and foods have been created on earth.

gurmukhi: ਤਰੁਵਰ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ ਫੁਲ ਫਲ ਸਾਖਾ ਪਤ ਮੂਲ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Taruvar Chhaaiaa Phul Phal Saakhaa Pat Mool Bahu Bhaaraa.
translation: Shady trees, flowers, fruits, branches, leaves, roots exist there.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਬਤ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਸਟਧਾਤੁ ਲਾਲੁ ਜਵਾਹਰੁ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Parabat Andari Asat Dhaatu Laalu Javaaharu Paarasi Paaraa.
translation: In the mountains are eight metals, rubies, jewels, philosopher's stone and mercury.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀ ਲਖ ਜੋਨਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਵਿਛੁੜੇ ਵਡ ਪਰਵਾਰਾ
transliteration: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Vichi Mili Mili Vichhurhay Vad Paravaaraa.
translation: Among the eighty four Lacs of species of life, large families meet only to part i.e. they take birth and die.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਮਣੁ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਮਰਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਭਵਜਲ ਪੂਰ ਭਰਾੲਿ ਹਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Janmanu Jeevanu Maran Vichi Bhavajal Poor Bharaai Hajaaraa.
translation: In the cycle of transmigration the herds of creatures in this world -ocean come and go in thousands..

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹੀ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ ||੫||
transliteration: Maanas Dayhee Paari Outaaraa ?5?
translation: Only through the human body one can get across.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮ ਤੇ ਭੁੱਲ
translation: Human birth and error of life

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ਛਿਣ ਭੰਗਰੁ ਛਲ ਦੇਹੀ ਛਾਰਾ
transliteration: Maanas Janam Dulabhu Hai Chhin Bhangaru Chhal Dayhee Chhaaraa.
translation: Though human birth is a rare gift, yet this body being made of clay is momentary.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਦਾ ਕਰਿ ਪੂਤਰਾ ੳੁਡੈ ਨ ਪੳੁਣੁ ਖੁਲੇ ਨੳੁ ਦੁਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paanee Daa Kari Poutalaa Udai N Paounu Khulay Naoun Duaaraa.
translation: Made from ovum and semen, this airtight body has nine doors.

gurmukhi: ਅਗਨਿ ਕੁੰਡ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖੀਅਨਿ ਨਰਕ ਘੋਰ ਮਹਿਂ ੳੁਦਰੁ ਮਝਾਰਾ
transliteration: Agani Kound Vichi Rakheeani Narak Ghor Mahin Udaru Majhaaraa.
translation: That Lord saves this body even in the hellish fire of the mother's womb.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ੳੁਰਧ ਤਪੁ ਗਰਭ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਸਾ ਨ ਵਿਸਰੈ ਸਿਰਜਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Karai Uradh Tapu Garabh Vichi Chasaa N Visarai Sirajanahaaraa.
translation: During pregnancy the creature hangs upside down in the mother's womb and continuously meditates.

gurmukhi: ਦਸੀ ਮਹੀਨੀ ਜੰਮਿਅਾਂ ਸਿਮਰਣ ਕਰੀ ਕਰੇ ਨਿਸਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Dasee Maheeneen Janmiaan Simaran Karee Karay Nisataaraa.
translation: After ten months the ftv takes birth when because of that meditation it is liberated from that pool of fire.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਮਦੋ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੋਹਿਅਾ ਨਦਰਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ ਰਖਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Janmado Maaiaa Mohiaa Nadari N Aavai Rakhanahaaraa.
translation: Right from the time of birth he gets engrossed in maya and now that protector Lord is not beheld by him.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹੋਂ ਵਿਛੁੜਿਅਾ ਵਣਜਾਰਾ ||੬||
transliteration: Saahon Vichhurhiaa Vanajaaraa ?6?
translation: Jiv the travelling trader thus gets separated from the Lord, the great banker.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮ- ਮਾਯਾ ਜਾਲ
translation: Human birth--a web of maya -

gurmukhi: ਰੋਵੈ ਰਤਨੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੋਹੁ ਅਨੇਰੁ ਗੁਬਾਰਾ
transliteration: Rovai Ratanu Gavaai Kai Maaiaa Mohu Anayru Goubaaraa.
translation: Losing the jewel (in the form of the name of the Lord) the creature (on his birth) wails and weeps in utter darkness of maya and infatuation.

gurmukhi: ਓਹੁ ਰੋਵੈ ਦੁਖੁ ਅਾਪਣਾ ਹਸਿ ਹਸਿ ਗਾਵੈ ਸਭ ਪਰਵਾਰਾ
transliteration: Aohu Rovai Doukhu Aapanaa Hasi Hasi Gaavai Sabh Paravaaraa.
translation: He cries because of his own suffering but the whole family sings merrily.

gurmukhi: ਸਭਨਾਂ ਮਨਿ ਵਾਧਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਰੁਣ ਝੁੰਝਨੜਾ ਰੁਣ ਝੁਣਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sabhanaan Mani Vaadhaaeeaan Roun Jhujhanarhaa Roun Jhounakaaraa.
translation: The heart of all is full of happiness and musical sound of drums is heard all around.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਦਾਦਕੁ ਸੋਹਲੇ ਦੇਨਿ ਅਸੀਸਾਂ ਬਾਲੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Naanaku Daadaku Sohalay Dayni Aseesaan Baalu Piaaraa.
translation: Singing songs of happiness maternal and paternal families bless the beloved child.

gurmukhi: ਚੁਖਹੁਂ ਬਿੰਦਕ ਬਿੰਦੁ ਕਰਿ ਬਿੰਦਹੁਂ ਕੀਤਾ ਪਰਬਤ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Choukhahoun Bindak Bindu Kari Bindahoun Keetaa Parabat Bhaaraa.
translation: From a small drop it increased and now that drop looks like a mountain.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿ ਸੰਤੋਖ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਧਰਮੁ ਅਰਥੁ ਸੁਗਰਥ ਵਿਸਾਰਿ ਵਿਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sati Santokh Daiaa Dharamu Aradu Sougarad Visaari Visaaraa.
translation: Having grown up, he has with pride forgotten the truth, contentment, compassion, dharma and higher values.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕਰੋਧੁ ਵਿਰੋਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਲੋਭੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਧ੍ਰੋਹ ਅਹੰਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaam Karodhu Virodhu Vichi Lobhu Mohu Dharoh Ahankaaraa.
translation: He started living among desires, anger, oppositions, greed, infatuation, treachery and pride,

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਜਾਲ ਫਾਥਾ ਵੇਚਾਰਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Mahaan Jaal Dhaadaa Vaychaaraa ?7?
translation: And thus the poor fellow got entangled in the larg web of maya..

gurmukhi: ੮ ਬਾਲਕ ਬੁੱਧਿ ਅਚੇਤ
translation: Child's intellect is unconscious

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਚੇਤ ਅਚੇਤ ੲਿਵ ਅਖੀਂ ਹੋਂਦੀ ਅੰਨ੍ਹਾ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Hoi Souchayt Achayt Iv Akheen Hondee Annhaa Hoaa.
translation: The jiv though consciousness incarnate is so much unconscious (of his aim in life) as if he is blind though having the eyes;

gurmukhi: ਵੈਰੀ ਮਿਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣਦਾ ਡਾੲਿਣੁ ਮਾੳੁ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਸਮੋਅਾ
transliteration: Vairee Mitu N Jaanadaa Daainu Maau Soubhaau Samoaa.
translation: Does not distinguish between a friend and a foe; and according to him the nature of a mother and a witch is identical.

gurmukhi: ਬੋਲਾ ਕੰਨੀ ਹੋਂਦੲੀ ਜਸੁ ਅਪਜਸੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਧੋਹੁ ਨਾ ਸੋਅਾ
transliteration: Bolaa Kanneen Honvadee Jasu Apajasu Mohu Dhohu N Soaa.
translation: He is deaf despite ears and does not distinguish between glory and infamy or between love and treachery.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੰਗਾ ਜੀਭੈ ਹੁੰਦੀਅੈ ਦੁਧੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਿਸੁ ਘੋਲਿ ਮੁਹਿ ਚੋਅਾ
transliteration: Goungaa Jeebhai Houndeeai Dudhu Vichi Visu Gholi Muhi Choaa.
translation: He is dumb despite tongue and drinks poison mixed in milk.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਹੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਸਮਸਰ ਪੀਅੈ ਮਰਣ ਜੀਵਨ ਅਾਸ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਨ ਢੋਅਾ
transliteration: Vihu Anmrit Samasar Peeai Maran Jeevan Aas Traas N Ddhoaa.
translation: Considering poison and nectar identical he drinks them

gurmukhi: ਸਰਪੁ ਅਗਨਿ ਵਲਿ ਹਥੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਕਰੈ ਮਨੋਰਥ ਪਕੜ ਖਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Sarapu Agani Vali Hadu Paai Karai Manorad Pakarhi Khaloaa.
translation: And for his ignorance about life and death, hopes and desires, he gets no refuge anywhere.

gurmukhi: ਸਮਝੈ ਨਾਹੀ ਟਿਬਾ ਟੋਅਾ ||੮||
transliteration: Samajhai Naahee Tibaa Toaa ?8?
translation: He stretches his desires towards snake and fire and catching hold of them does not distinguish between a pit and a mound.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਬਾਲਕ ਵਿਚਾਰ ਹੀਨਤਾ
translation: Child's thoughtlessness

gurmukhi: ਲੂਲਾ ਪੈਰੀ ਹੋਦੲੀ ਟੰਗਾਂ ਮਾਰਿ ਨ ੳੁਠਿ ਖਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Loolaa Pairee Honvadee Tangaan Maari N Outdi Khaloaa.
translation: Though with feet, a child (man) is cripple and cannot stand upon his legs.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੋ ਹਥੁ ਨਚਾੲੀਅੈ ਅਾਸਾ ਬੰਧੀ ਹਾਰੁ ਪਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Hado Hadu Nachaaeeai Aasaa Bandhee Haaru Paroaa.
translation: Weamig the garland of hopes and desises he dances in the arms of others.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਦਮ ੳੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ ਦੇਹਿ ਬਿਦੇਹਿ ਨ ਨਵਾਂ ਨਿਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Udam Oukati N Aavaee Dayhi Bidayhi N Navaan Niroaa.
translation: He knows neither technique nor enterprise, and being careless toward the body, he does not keep fit and healthy.

gurmukhi: ਹਗਣ ਮੂਤਣ ਛਡਣਾ ਰੋਗੁ ਸੋਗੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਦੁਖੀਅਾ ਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Hagan Mootan Chhadanaa Rogu Sogu Vichi Doukheeaa Roaa.
translation: Having no control over his excretory organs of uinating and defecation he cries of disease and suffering.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਟੀ ਪੀਅੈ ਨ ਖੁਸੀ ਹੋਹਿ ਸਪਹੁੰ ਰਖਿਅੜਾ ਅਣਖੋਅਾ
transliteration: Ghoutee Peeai N Khousee Hoi Sapahoun Rakhiaarhaa Anakhoaa.
translation: He does not take the first food (of the name of the Lord) happily and goes on catching snakes (in the form of passions and desires) stubbornly.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣੁ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਨ ਵਿਚਾਰਦਾ ਨ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੁ ਵਿਕਾਰੁ ਅਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Gounu Avagoun N Vichaaradaa N Oupakaaru Vikaaru Aloaa.
translation: Never pondering upon merits and demerits and not becoming benevolent, he always looks at evil propensities.

gurmukhi: ਸਮਸਰ ਤਿਸੁ ਹਥੀਅਾਰੁ ਸੰਜੋਅਾ ||੯||
transliteration: Samasari Tisu Hadeeaaru Sanjoaa ?9?
translation: For such a (foolish) person, the weapon and the armour are identical.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਮਾਤਾ ੳੁਪਕਾਰ
translation: Benefactions of mother

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਮਿਲਿ ਨਿੰਮਿਅਾ ਅਾਸਾਵੰਤੀ ੳੁਦਰੁ ਮਝਾਰੇ
transliteration: Maat Pitaa Mili Nimiaa Aasaavantee Udaru Majhaaray.
translation: Meeting and mating of mother and father makes the mother pregnant who becoming hopeful keeps the child in her womb.

gurmukhi: ਰਸ ਕਸ ਖਾੲਿ ਨਿਲਜ ਹੋੲਿ ਛਹੁ ਛਹੁ ਧਰਣਿ ਧਰੈ ਪਗ ਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ras Kas Khaai Nilaj Hoi Chhuh Chhuh Dharani Dharai Pag Dhaaray.
translation: She enjoys edibles and unedibles without any inhibition and moves carefully with measured steps on the earth.

gurmukhi: ਪੇਟ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਸ ਮਾਹ ਰਖਿ ਪੀੜਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਜਣੈ ਪੁਤੁ ਪਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Payt Vichi Das Maah Rakhi Peerhaa Khaai Janai Poutu Piaaray.
translation: She gives birth to her dear son after bearing the pain of carrying him in her womb for ten months.

gurmukhi: ਜਣ ਕੈ ਪਾਲੈ ਕਸਟ ਕਰਿ ਖਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੰਜਮ ਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jan Kai Paalai Kasat Kari Khaan Paan Vichi Sanjam Saaray.
translation: Having delivered, the mother nourishes the child and herself remains moderate in eating and drinking.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੜ੍ਹਤੀ ਦੇੲਿ ਪਿਅਾਲਿ ਦੁਧੁ ਘੁਟੀ ਵਟੀ ਦੇੲਿ ਨਿਹਾਰੇ
transliteration: Gurhhatee Dayi Piaali Dudhu Ghoutee Vatee Dayi Nihaaray.
translation: Having ministered the customary first food, and milk, she stares at him with deep love.

gurmukhi: ਛਾਦਨੁ ਭੋਜਨੁ ਪੋਖਿਅਾ ਝੰਡਨ ਮੰਗਨ ਪੜ੍ਹਨ ਚਿਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Chhaadanu Bhojanu Pokhiaa Bhadani Mangani Parhhani Chitaaray.
translation: She thinks about his food, clothes, tonsure, betrothal, education etc.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਂਧੇ ਪਾਸਿ ਬਹਾਲਿਅਾ ਖਟਿ ਲੁਟਾੲਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਚਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Paandhay Paasi Parhhaaiaa Khati Loutaai Hoi Souchiaaray.
translation: Throwing handful of coins over his head and giving him a proper bath she sends him to the pundit for education.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਿਣਤ ਹੋੲੇ ਭਾਰੁ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Urinat Hoi Bhaaru Outaaray ?10?
translation: This way she clears the debt (of her motherhood).

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਮਾਤਾ ੳੁਪਕਾਰ, ਪੁੱਤ੍ਰ ਅਪਕਾਰ
translation: Benefaction of mother and maltreatment of son) ,

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਅਨੰਦ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੁਤੈ ਦੀ ਕੁੜਮਾੲੀ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Maataa Pitaa Anad Vichi Poutai Dee Kurhamaaee Hoee.
translation: Parents are happy that the betrothel ceremony of their son has been solemnized.

gurmukhi: ਰਹਸੀ ਅੰਗ ਨ ਮਾਵੲੀ ਗਾਵੈ ਸੋਹਿਲੜੇ ਸੁਖ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Rahasee Ang N Maavaee Gaavai Sohilarhay Soukh Soee.
translation: Mother becomes overjoyed and sings songs of happiness.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਗਸੀ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਵਿਅਾਹਿਅੈ ਘੋੜੀ ਲਾਵਾਂ ਗਾਵ ਭਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Vigasee Pout Viaahiai Ghorhee Laavaan Gaav Bhaloee.
translation: Singing eulogies of bridegroom, and praying for the welfare of the couple she feels very happy that her son got married.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖਾਂ ਸੁਖੈ ਮਾਵੜੀ ਪੁਤੁ ਨੂੰਹ ਦਾ ਮੇਲ ਅਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Soukhaan Soukhai Maavarhee Poutu Noonh Daa Mayl Aloee.
translation: For the well-being and harmony of bride and bridegroom the mother makes vows of offerings (before the deities).

gurmukhi: ਨੁਹੁ ਨਿਤ ਕੰਤ ਕੁਮੰਤੁ ਦੇੲਿ ਵਿਹਰੇ ਹੋਵਨਿ ਸਸੁ ਵਿਗੋੲੀ
transliteration: Nuhu Nit Kant Koumantu Dayi Viharay Hovahu Sasu Vigoee.
translation: Now, the bride starts ill-advising the son, goading him to get separate from the parents, and consequently the mother-in-law becomes sorrowful.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿ ਕੈ ਪੁਤੁ ਕੁਪੁਤਿ ਚਕੀ ੳੁਠਿ ਝੋੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Oupakaaru Visaari Kai Pout Koupouti Chakee Outdi Jhoee.
translation: Forgetting lacs of benefactions (of mother) the son becomes disloyal and sets himself at logger-heads with his parents.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਵੈ ਸਰਵਣ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਕੋੲੀ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Hovai Saravan Viralaa Koee ?11?
translation: Rare is any obdient son like Sravan of mythology who was most obedient to his blind parents.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਮਾਪਿਅਾਂ ਦਾ ੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਵਿਸਾਰਨਾ ਪਾਪ ਹੈ
translation: lt is sin to forget the benefactions of parents

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਣਿ ਕਾਮਣਿਅਾਰੀਅੈ ਕੀਤੋ ਕਾਮਣੁ ਕੰਤ ਪਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Kaamani Kaamaniaareeai Keeto Kaamanu Kant Piaaray.
translation: The enchantress wife with her charms made the husband dote on her.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਮੇ ਸਾੲੀਂ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਅਾ ਵੀਵਾਹਿਅਾ ਮਾਂ ਪਿਓ ਵਿਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Janmay Saaeen Visaariaa Veevaahiaan Maan Pia Visaaray.
translation: He forgot the parents who had given him birth and had got him married.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖਾਂ ਸੁਖਿ ਵਿਵਾਹਿਅਾ ਸੳੁਣੁ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਵਿਚਾਰਿ ਵਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Soukhaan Soukhi Vivaahiaa Saounu Sanjogu Vichaari Vichaaray.
translation: Having made vows of offerings and considerd many good and bad omens and auspicious combinations, his marriage had been arranged by them.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਤ ਨੂਹੈਂ ਦਾ ਮੇਲੁ ਵੇਖਿ ਅੰਗ ਨ ਮਾਵਨਿ ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Pout Noohain Daa Maylu Vaykhi Ang Naa Maavani Maan Piu Vaaray.
translation: Seeing at the meetings of the son and the daughter-in-law, the parents had felt over­joyed.

gurmukhi: ਨੁੰਹੁ ਨਿਤ ਮੰਤ ਕੁਮੰਤ ਦੇੲਿ ਮਾਂ ਪਿਓ ਛਡਿ ਵਡੇ ਹਤਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Noonh Nit Mant Koumant Dayi Maan Piu Chhadi Vaday Hatiaaray.
translation: The bride then started continuously advising the husband to desert his parents instigating that they had been tyrants.

gurmukhi: ਵਖ ਹੋਵੈ ਪੁਤੁ ਰੰਨਿ ਲੈ ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਦੇ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੁ ਵਿਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Vakh Hovai Poutu Ranni Lai Maan Piu Day Oupakaaru Visaaray.
translation: Forgetting the benefactions of parents, the son alongwith his wife got separated from them.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਕਾਚਾਰਿ ਹੁੲਿ ਵਡੇ ਕੁਚਾਰੇ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Lokaachaari Hoi Vaday Kouchaaray ?12?
translation: Now the way of the world has become grossly immoral.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਮਾਪਿਅਾਂ ਦੇ ਅਪਕਾਰੀ ਦੇ ਜਪ ਤਪ ਨਿਸਫਲ ਹਨ
translation: Pities of one who ill-treated the parents are in vain

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਸੁਣੈ ਵੇਦੁ ਭੇਦੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ਕਥਾ ਕਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Sounai Vaydu Bhaydu N Jaanai Kadaa Kahaanee.
translation: Renouncing the parents, the listener of Vedas cannot understand their mystery.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਕਰੈ ਤਪੁ ਵਣਖੰਡਿ ਭੁਲਾ ਫਿਰੈ ਬਿਬਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Tapu Vanakhandi Bhulaa Dhirai Bibaanee.
translation: Repudiating the parents, meditation in the forest is similar to the wanderings at deserted places.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਕਰੈ ਪੂਜੁ ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਨ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Pooju Dayvee Dayv N Sayv Kamaanee.
translation: The service and worship to the gods and goddesses are useless if one has renounced his parents.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਨ੍ਹਾਵਣਾ ਅਠਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਘੁੰਮਣ ਵਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Nhaavanaa Atdasatdi Teerad Ghounman Vaanee.
translation: Without service to the parents, bath at the sixty-eight pilgrimage centres is nothing but gyrating in a whirlpool.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਕਰੈ ਦਾਨ ਬੇੲੀਮਾਨ ਅਗਿਅਾਨ ਪਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Daan Bayeemaan Agiaan Paraanee.
translation: The person who having deserted his parents performs charities, is corrupt and ignorant.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਵਰਤ ਕਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੰਮੈ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਣੀ
transliteration: Maan Piu Parahari Varat Kari Mari Mari Janmai Bharami Bhulaanee.
translation: He who repudiating the parents undertakes fasts, goes on to wander in the cycle of births and deaths.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਸਾਰੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੀ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Guru Paramaysaru Saaru N Jaanee ?13?
translation: That man (in fact) has not understood the essence of Guru and God.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਨੂੰ ਸੰਭਾਲ
translation: Cherish in heart the benevolent Creator

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰੁ ਮਨਹੁਂ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਅਾ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਾਦਰੁ ਦਿਸੈ
transliteration: Kaadaru Manahu Visaariaa Kudarati Andari Kaadaru Disai.
translation: In nature that creator is beheld but the jiv has forgotten him.

gurmukhi: ਜੀੳੁ ਪਿੰਡ ਦੇ ਸਾਜਿਅਾ ਸਾਸ ਮਾਸ ਦੇ ਜਿਸੈ ਕਿਸੈ
transliteration: Jeeu Pind Day Saajiaa Saas Maas Day Jisai Kisai.
translation: Bestowing body, vital air, flesh and breath upon every one, He has created one and all.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀਂ ਮੁਹੁਂ ਨਕੁ ਕੰਨੁ ਦੇੲਿ ਹਥੁ ਪੈਰੁ ਸਭਿ ਦਾਤ ਸੁ ਤਿਸੈ
transliteration: Akhee Muhu Naku Kannu Dayi Hadu Pairu Sabhi Daat Su Tisai.
translation: As gifts, eyes, mouth, nose, ears, hands, and feet have been given by Him.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀਂ ਦੇਖੈ ਰੂਪ ਰੰਗੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮੁਹਿ ਕੰਨ ਸਰਿਸੈ
transliteration: Akheen Daykhai Roop Rangu Sabad Surati Muhi Kann Sarisai.
translation: Man beholds form and colour through eyes and through mouth and ears he speaks and listens to the Word respectively.

gurmukhi: ਨਕ ਵਾਸ ਹਥੀਂ ਕਿਰਤ ਪੈਰੀ ਚਲਣ ਪਲ ਪਲ ਖਿਸੈ
transliteration: Naki Vaasu Hadeen Kirati Pairee Chalan Pal Pal Khisai.
translation: Smelling through nose and working with hands, he slides on his feet slowly.

gurmukhi: ਵਾਲ ਦੰਦ ਮੂੰਹ ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਸਾਸ ਗਿਰਾਸਿ ਸਮਾਲਿ ਸਲਿਸੈ
transliteration: Vaal Dand Nahu Rom Rom Saasi Giraasi Samaali Salisai.
translation: He carefully keeps his hair, teeth, nails, trichomes, breath and food. Jiv, you getting controlled by the taste and greed always remember the worldly masters.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਦੀ ਲਬੈ ਸਾਹਿਬੋ ਤਿਸ ਤੂੰ ਸੰਮਲ ਸੌਵੈਂ ਹਿਸੈ
transliteration: Saadee Labai Saahibo Tis Toon Sanmal Saivain Hisai.
translation: Do remember that Lord too just one hundredth part of it.

gurmukhi: ਲੂਣ ਪਾੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਟੈ ਮਿਸੈ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Loonu Paai Kari Aatai Misai ?14?
translation: Put salt of devotion in the flour of life and make it tasteful.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਜਾਗਦਿਅਾਂ ਜੇਹੀ ਸੁਰਤ ਤੇਹੀ ਸ੍ਵਪਨ ਵਿਚ
translation: Same consciousness while waking as well as in dreaming

gurmukhi: ਦੇਹੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਨ ਜਾਪੲੀ ਨੀਂਦ ਭੁਖੁ ਤੇਹ ਕਿਥੈ ਵਸੈ
transliteration: Dayhee Vichi N Jaapaee Neend Bhoukhu Tayh Kidai Vasai.
translation: None knows the residing place of sleep and hunger in the body.

gurmukhi: ਹਸਣੁ ਰੋਵਣੁ ਗਾਵਣਾ ਛਿਕ ਡਿਕਾਰੁ ਖੰਘੂਰਣੁ ਦਸੈ
transliteration: Hasanu Rovanu Gaavanaa Chhik Dikaaru Khangooranu Dasai.
translation: Let somebody tell where live the laughter, weeping, singing, sneezing, eructation and cough in the body.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਲਕ ਤੇ ਅੰਗਵਾੜੀਅਾਂ ਹਿਡਕੀ ਖੁਰਕਣੁ ਪਰਸ ਪਰਸੈ
transliteration: Aalak Tay Angavaarheeaan Hidakee Khurakanu Paras Parasai.
translation: Whence idleness, yawning, hiccough, itch, gaping, sighing, snapping and clapping?

gurmukhi: ੳੁਭੇ ਸਾਹ ੳੁਬਾਸੀਅਾਂ ਚੁਟਕਾਰੀ ਤਾੜੀ ਸੁਣਿ ਕਿਸੈ
transliteration: Oubhay Saah Oubaaseeaan Choutakaaree Taarhee Souni Kisai.
translation: Hope, desire, happiness, sorrow, renunciation, enjoyment, suffering , pleasure, etc. are indestructible emotions.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਾ ਮਨਸਾ ਹਰਖੁ ਸੋਗੁ ਜੋਗੁ ਭੋਗੁ ਦੁਖੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਨ ਵਿਗਸੈ
transliteration: Aasaa Manasaa Harakhu Sogu Jogu Bhogu Doukhu Soukhu N Vinasai.
translation: Millions of thoughts and worries are there during waking hours

gurmukhi: ਜਾਗਦਿਅਾਂ ਲਖੁ ਚਿਤਵਣੀ ਸੁਤਾ ਸੁਹਣੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਧਸੈ
transliteration: Jaagadiaan Lakhu Chitavanee Soutaa Suhanay Andari Dhasai.
translation: And the same get deeply rooted in mind while one is asleep and dreaming.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਤਾ ਹੀ ਬਰੜਾਂਵਦਾ ਕਿਰਤ ਵਿਰਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਸ ਅਪਜਸੈ
transliteration: Soutaa Hee Bararhaanvadaa Kirati Virati Vichi Jas Apajasai.
translation: Whatever fame and infamy have been earned by man in his conscious state, he goes on muttering in sleep also.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਸਨਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਘਣਾ ਤਰਸੈ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Tisanaa Andari Ghanaa Tarasai ?15?
translation: Man controlled by desires, goes on intensely longing and yearning.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਦੁਰਮਤੀ- ੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਕੀਤੇ ਬੀ ਨਹੀਂ ਸੌਰਦਾ
translation: Even benevolence does not reclaim the evil person-

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਵਰਤਣਾ ਸਾਧੁ ਅਸਾਧੁ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਸੈ
transliteration: Guramati Duramati Varatanaa Saadhu Asaadhu Sangati Vichi Vasai.
translation: Persons keeping company of sadhus and evilmen act according to the wisdom of Guru, gurmat, and illwill respectively.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੰਨ ਵੇਸ ਜਮਵਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਮੁਣਸੈ
transliteration: Tinn Vays Jamavaar Vichi Hoi Sanjogu Vijogu Mounasai.
translation: Man acts according to three states of life (childhood, youth, oldage) subject to safijog, meeting, and vijog, separation.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਕੁਬਾਣ ਨ ਵਿਸਰੈ ਸਿਰਜਣਹਾਰੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿ ਵਿਗਸੈ
transliteration: Sahas Koubaan N Visarai Sirajanahaaru Visaari Vigasai.
translation: Thousands of bad habits are not forgotten but the creature, RV feels happy forgetting the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਨਾਰੀ ਪਰ ਦਰਬੁ ਹਿਤੁ ਪਰ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਪਰਪੰਚ ਰਹਸੈ
transliteration: Par Naaree Par Darabu Haytu Par Nidaa Parapanch Rahasai.
translation: He enjoys in being with other's woman, other's wealth, and other's slander.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਦਾਨ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਤਜਿ ਕੀਰਤਨ ਕਥਾ ਨ ਸਾਧੁ ਪਰਸੈ
transliteration: Naam Daan Isanaanu Taji Keeratan Kadaa N Saadhu Parasai.
translation: He has renounced rememberance of the Lord's name, charity and ablution and does not go to holy congregation to listen to discourses and kirtan, eulogies of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤਾ ਚੳੁਕ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲੀਅੈ ਚਕੀ ਚਟਣਿ ਕਾਰਣ ਨਸੈ
transliteration: Koutaa Chaouk Charhhaaeeai Chakee Chatani Kaaran Nasai.
translation: He is like that dog who though placed in a high position, yet runs for licking the flourmills.

gurmukhi: ਅਵਗੁਣਿਅਾਰਾ ਗੁਣ ਨ ਸਰਸੈ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Avagouniaaraa Goun N Sarasai ?16?
translation: Evil person never appreciates values of life.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਅਨੇਕਤਾ ਵਿਚ ੲਿਕ ਵਯਾਪਕ ਹੈ ਸੋ ਚੇਤ
translation: Remember the One pervading the many

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳ ਬਹੁ ਵਰਨ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਮੂਲ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਫਲੁ ਫੁਲੁ ਘਨੇਰੇ
transliteration: Jiu Bahu Varan Vanaasapati Mool Patr Phul Phalu Ghanayray.
translation: One vegetation universely maintains of roots, leaves, flowers and fruits.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਵਰਣ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੈ ਸਭਸੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਰਦਾ ਡੇਰੇ
transliteration: Ik Varanu Baisantarai Sabhanaa Andari Karadaa Dayray.
translation: The same one fire resides in variegated objects.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪੁ ਅਨੂਪ ਅਨੇਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਰੰਗੁ ਸੁਰੰਗ ਸੁ ਵਾਂਸ ਚੰਗੇਰੇ
transliteration: Roopu Anoopu Anayk Hoi Rangu Surangu Su Vaasu Changayray.
translation: The fragrance is the same which remains there in the materials of various hues and forms.

gurmukhi: ਵਾਂਸਹੁ ੳੁਠਿ ੳੁਪਠਿ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਲਿ ਕਰੰਦਾ ਭਸਮੈ ਢੇਰੇ
transliteration: Vaansahu Outdi Oupanni Kari Jaali Karandaa Bhasamai Ddhayray.
translation: Fire emerges from within the bamboos and bums the whole vegetation to reduce it to ashes.

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਬਿਰੰਗੀ ਗੳੂ ਵੰਸ ਅੰਗੁ ਅੰਗੁ ਧਰਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਲਵੇਰੇ
transliteration: Rang Birangee Gaoo Vans Angu Angu Dhari Naau Lavayray.
translation: Cows of different colours are given different names. The milkman grazes them all but every cow listening to its name moves towards the caller.

gurmukhi: ਸਦੀ ਅਾਵੈ ਨਾੳੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਪਾਲੀ ਚਾਰੈ ਮੇਰੇ ਤੇਰੇ
transliteration: Sadee Aavai Naau Souni Paalee Chaarai Mayray Tayray.
translation: Colour of the milk of every cow is the same (white).

gurmukhi: ਸਭਨਾ ਦਾ ੲਿਕੁ ਰੰਗੁ ਦੁਧ ਘਿਅ ਪਟ ਭਾਂਡੈ ਦੋਖ ਨੇ ਹੇਰੇ
transliteration: Sabhanaa Daa Iku Rangu Dudhu Ghia Pat Bhaandai Dokh N Hayray.
translation: Faults are not seen in ghee and silk i.e. one should not go for classes castes and varieties; only true humanity should be identified.

gurmukhi: ਚਿਤੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਚੇਤੁ ਚਿਤੇਰੇ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Chitai Andari Chaytu Chitayray ?17?
translation: 0 man, remember the artist of this artistic creation!

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਅਨੇਕਤਾ ਵਿਚ ੲਿਕ ਕਰਤੇ ਨੂੰ ਕੀਤਾ ਨਹੀਂ ਚੇਤਦਾ
translation: The creature does not remember unity in divesity of the creator

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਪਾਣੀ ਵਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਫੁਲੀ ਵਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਚੰਗੇਰੀ
transliteration: Dharatee Paanee Vaasu Hai Phulee Vaasu Nivaasu Changayree.
translation: Earth resides in water and fragrance resides in flowers.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਲ ਫੁਲਾਂ ਦੇ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਤਿਤੁ ਪੁਨੀਤੁ ਫੁਲੇਲ ਘਵੇਰੀ
transliteration: Til Phulaan Day Sangi Mili Patitu Pouneetu Phulaylu Ghavayree.
translation: The degraded sesame seed mixing with the essence of flowers becomes sanctified as fragrant scent.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀਂ ਦੇਖਿ ਅਨ੍ਹੇਰ ਕਰਿ ਮਨ ਅੰਧੇ ਤਨ ਅੰਧ ਅੰਧੇਰੀ
transliteration: Akhee Daykhi Anhayru Kari Mani Andhay Tani Andhu Andhayree.
translation: The blind mind even after beholding through the physical eyes, behaves like a creature living in darkness,i,e. man is spiritually blind though he beholds physically.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੂਰਜ ੲਿਕੁ ਨ ਘੁਘੂ ਹੇਰੀ
transliteration: Chhia Rout Baarah Maah Vichi Sooraju Iku N Ghoughoo Hayree.
translation: In all the six seasons and twelve months, the same one sun operates but the owl does not see it.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਰਣ ਕੂੰਜ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਕਛੁ ਪਥਰ ਕੀੜੇ ਰਿਜਕ ਸਵੇਰੀ
transliteration: Simarani Koonj Dhiaanu Kachhu Padar Keerhay Rijaku Savayree.
translation: Remembrance and meditation nurture the offsprings of florican and tortoise and that Lord provides livelihood to the worms of the stones as well.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਤੈ ਨੋ ਕੀਤਾ ਨ ਚਿਤੇਰੀ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Karatay No Keetaa N Chitayree ?18?
translation: Even then the creature (man) does not remember that Creator.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਸਦਾ ਅੰਨ੍ਹੇ ਹਨ
translation: Manmukhs, the mind-oriented, are blind

gurmukhi: ਘੁਘੂ ਚਾਮਚਿੜਕ ਨੋ ਦੇਹੁਂ ਨ ਸੁਝੈ ਚਾਨਣ ਹੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Ghoughoo Chaamachirhak No Dayhoun N Sujhai Chaanan Honday.
translation: Nothing can be seen by bat and owl in the day light.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤਿ ਅਨ੍ਹੇਰੀ ਦੇਖਦੇ ਬੋਲੁ ਕੁਬੋਲੁ ਅਬੋਲੁ ਖਲੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Raati Anhayree Daykhaday Bolu Koubol Abol Khalonday.
translation: They see only in the dark night. They keep silent but as and when they speak their sound is evil.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਅੰਨ੍ਹੇ ਰਾਤਿ ਦਿਹੁਂ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਵਿਹੂਣੇ ਚਕੀ ਝੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Manamoukh Annhay Raati Dihoun Surati Vihoonay Chakee Jhonday.
translation: Manmukhs also remain blind day and night and being devoid of consciousness go on operating the quern of discord.

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਗੁਣ ਚੁਣਿ ਚੁਣਿ ਛਡਿ ਗੁਣ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਹੀਰੇ ਫਟਕ ਪਰੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Aougoun Chouni Chouni Chhadi Goun Parahari Heeray Dhatak Paronday.
translation: They pick up demerits and leave out merits; they reject the diamond and prepare the string of stones.

gurmukhi: ਨਾੳੁ ਸੁਜਾਖੇ ਅੰਨ੍ਹਿਅਾਂ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਦ ਮਤਵਾਲੇ ਰੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Naau Sujaakhay Annhiaan Maaiaa Mad Matavaalay Ronday.
translation: These blind ones are called sujOns, the learned and intelligent ones. Inebrigated with the pride of their wealth they wail and weep.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕਰੋਧ ਵਿਰੋਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਾਰੇ ਪਲੇ ਭਰਿ ਭਰਿ ਧੋਂਦੇ
transliteration: Kaam Karodh Virodh Vichi Chaaray Palay Bhari Bhari Dhonday.
translation: Engrossed in lust, anger and antagonism they wash the four corners of their stained sheet.

gurmukhi: ਪਥਰ ਪਾਪ ਨ ਛੁਟਹਿ ਢੋਂਦੇ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Padar Paap N Chhoutahi Ddhonday ?19?
translation: They never get liberated from carrying the load of their stony sins.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਨੂੰ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ
translation: Manmukh returns evil for good done to him

gurmukhi: ਥਲਾਂ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਕ ੳੁਗਵਨਿ ਵੁਠੇ ਮੀਂਹ ਪਵੈ ਮੁਹਿ ਮੋਅਾ
transliteration: Dalaan Andari Aku Ougavani Voutday Meenh Pavai Muhi Moaa.
translation: Akk plant grows in sandy regions and during rain it falls on its face.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿ ਟੁਟੈ ਦੁਧ ਵਹਿ ਚਲੈ ਪੀਤੈ ਕਾਲਕੂਟ ਓਹੁ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Pati Toutai Dudhu Vahi Chalai Peetai Kaalakootu Aohu Hoaa.
translation: Milk oozes out of it when its leaf is plucked but it turns out to be poison when drunk.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਹੁਂ ਫਲ ਹੁੲਿ ਖਖੜੀ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਸੋ ਫਲ ਅਕਤਿਡੁ ਭੋਅਾ
transliteration: Akahoun Phal Hoi Khakharhee Nihaphalu So Phalu Akatidu Bhoaa.
translation: The pod is a useless fruit of akk liked only by grasshoppers.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਹੁ ਨਸੈ ਅਕ ਦੁਧ ਤੇ ਸਪੁ ਖਾਧਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਅਕ ਨਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Vihu Nasai Ak Dudh Tay Sapu Khaadhaa Khaai Ak Naroaa.
translation: The poison gets diluted by akk-milk and (sometimes) a person bitten by sanke gets cured of its poison.

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਅਕ ਚਰਿ ਕੈ ਬਕਰੀ ਦੇੲਿ ਦੁਧੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਮੋਹਿ ਚੋਅਾ
transliteration: So Ak Chari Kai Bakaree Dayi Dudhu Anmrit Mohi Choaa.
translation: When a goat grazes the same akk,it yeilds nectar-like drinkable milk.

gurmukhi: ਸਪੈ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਅਾਲੀਅੈ ਵਿਸੁ ੳੁਗਾਲੈ ਪਾਸਿ ਖੜੋਅਾ
transliteration: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Visu Ougaalai Paasi Kharhoaa.
translation: Milk given to snake is belched out by it instantly in the form of poison.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਕਰਿ ਢੋਅਾ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Goun Keetay Avagounu Kari Ddhoaa ?20?
translation: The wicked person returns evil for good done to him.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਨਿਗੁਰਾ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਵੱਸ ਨਹੀਂ ਅਾ ਸਕਦਾ
translation: Man having no Guru is uncontrollable

gurmukhi: ਕੁਹੈ ਕਸਾੲੀ ਬਕਰੀ ਲਾੲਿ ਲੂਣ ਸੀਖ ਮਾਸੁ ਪਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Kuhai Kasaaee Bakaree Laai Loon Seekh Maasu Paroaa.
translation: The butcher slaughters goat and its meats is salted and strung on a skewer.

gurmukhi: ਹਸਿ ਹਸਿ ਬੋਲੈ ਕੁਹੀਂਦੀ ਖਾਧੇ ਅਕੁ ਹਾਲ ੲਿਹ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Hasi Hasi Bolay Kuheendee Khaadhay Aki Haalu Ihu Hoaa.
translation: Laughingly, the goat says while being killed that I have come to this condition only for grazing leaves of akk plant.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਸ ਖਾਨ ਗਲ ਛੁਰੀ ਦੇ ਹਾਲ ਤਿਨਾੜਾ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਅਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Maas Khaani Gali Chhuree Day Haalu Tinaarhaa Kaounu Aloaa.
translation: But what will be the plight of those who cutting the throat with knife eat flesh (of animal).

gurmukhi: ਜੀਭੈ ਹੰਦਾ ਫੇੜਿਅੈ ਖੳੁ ਦੰਦਾਂ ਮੁਹੁ ਭੰਨਿ ਵਿਗੋਅਾ
transliteration: Jeebhai Handaa Dhayrhiaa Khau Dandaan Muhu Bhanni Vigoaa.
translation: The perverted taste of the tongue is harmful for the teeth and damages the mouth.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਤਨ ਪਰ ਧਨ ਨਿੰਦ ਕਰਿ ਹੋਅਾ ਦੁਜੀਭਾ ਬਿਸੀਅਰੁ ਭੋਅਾ
transliteration: Par Tan Par Dhan Nid Kari Hoi Dujeebhaa Biseearu Bhoaa.
translation: The enjoyer of other's wealth, body and slander becomes a poisonous amphisbaena.

gurmukhi: ਵਸਿ ਅਾਵੈ ਗੁਰਮੰਤ ਸੁਣਿ ਨਿਗੁਰਾ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਸੁਣੈ ਨ ਸੋਅਾ
transliteration: Vasi Aavai Guroumant Sapu Niguraa Manamoukhu Sounai N Soaa.
translation: This snake is controlled by the mantra of the Guru but manmukh, devoid of Guru, never listens to the glory of such mantra.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਖਿ ਨ ਚਲੈ ਅਗੈ ਟੋਅਾ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Vaykhi N Chalai Agai Toaa ?21?
translation: While moving ahead, he never beholds the pit before him.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਖੋਟਾ ਦਾੳੁ ਹੈ
translation: The sense of duality is a wrong bet

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਿ ਨ ਵੰਞਞਞਞੈ ਸਾਹੁਰੈ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਮਤੀਂ ਦੇ ਸਮਝਾੲੇ
transliteration: Aapi N Vanai Saahurai Lokaa Matee Day Samajhaaay.
translation: The wicked girl herself does not go to her father-in-law's house but teaches others how to behave at in -laws' house.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਨਣੁ ਘਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਦੀਵਿਅਹੁਂ ਹੇਠ ਅੰਨੇਰੁ ਨ ਸਕੈ ਮਿਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chaananu Ghari Vichi Deeviahu Haytd Annayru N Sakai Mitaaay.
translation: Lamp can enlighten the house but it cannot dispel the darkness underneath itself.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੁ ਦੀਵਾ ਫੜਿ ਅਾਖੁੜੈ ਹੁੲਿ ਚਕਚੳੁਧੀ ਪੈਰ ਥਿੜਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Hadu Deevaa Dharhi Aakhurhai Hui Chakachaudhee Pairu Dirhaaay.
translation: The man walking with lamp in hand stumbles because he is dazzled by its flame.

gurmukhi: ਹਥ ਕੰਙਣੁ ਲੈ ਅਾਰਸੀ ਅੳੁਖਾ ਹੋਵੈ ਦੇਖਿ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Had Kannu Lai Aarasee Aoukhaa Hovai Daykhi Dikhaaay.
translation: He who tries to see the reflection of his bracelet in a avast;

gurmukhi: ਦੀਵਾ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਹਥੁ ਲੈ ਅਾਰਸੀ ਦੂਜੈ ਹਥਿ ਫੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Deevaa Ikatu Hadu Lai Aarasee Doojai Hadi Dharhaaay.
translation: Mirror worn on the thumb of the same hand can hardly see it or show it to other.

gurmukhi: ਹੁੰਦੇ ਦੀਵੇ ਅਾਰਸੀ ਅਾਖੁਰ ਟੋੲੇ ਪਾੳੁਂਦਾ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Hounday Deevay Aarasee Aakhurhi Toay Paaoundaa Jaaay.
translation: Now if he catches hold of a mirror in one hand and lamp in the other even then he would stumble into a pit.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਕੁਦਾੳੁ ਹਰਾੲੇ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Haraaay ?22?
translation: Double-mindedness is an evil stake which ultimately causes defeat.

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਅਕ੍ਰਿਤਘਨ ਹੈ
translation: Manmukh is ungrateful

gurmukhi: ਅਮਿਅ ਸਰੋਵਰੁ ਮਰੈ ਡੁਬਿ ਤਰੈ ਨ ਮਨਤਾਰੂ ਸੁ ਅਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Amia Sarovari Marai Doubi Tarai N Manataaroo Su Avaaee.
translation: A headstrong non swimmer would drown and die even in the tank of nectar.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਿ ਨ ਪੱਥਰਹੁਂ ਕੰਚਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਅਘੜੁ ਘੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Paarasu Parasi N Padarahu Kanchanu Hoi N Agharhu Ghurhaaee.
translation: Touching the philosopher's stone another stone does not transform into gold nor can it be chiselled into an ornament.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸੀਅਰੁ ਵਿਸੁ ਨ ਪਰਹਰੈ ਅਠ ਪਹਰਿ ਚੰਨਣਿ ਲਪਟਾੲੀ
transliteration: Biseearu Visu N Paraharai Atd Pahar Channani Lapataaee.
translation: Snake does not shed its poison though it may remain entwined with sandalwood all the eight watches (day and night).

gurmukhi: ਸੰਖ ਸਮੁੰਦਹੁਂ ਸਖਣਾ ਰੋਵੈ ਧਾਹਾਂ ਮਾਰਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sankh Samoundahu Sakhanaa Rovai Dhaahaan Maari Sounaai.
translation: In spite of living,in the sea, the conch remains empty and hollow and cries bitterly (when blown).

gurmukhi: ਘੁਘੂ ਸੁਝ ਨ ਸੁਝੲੀ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਜੋਤਿ ਨ ਲੁਕੈ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Sooraju Joti N Loukai Loukaaee.
translation: Owl beholds nothing while nothing is hidden in sunshine.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਵਡਾ ਅਕ੍ਰਿਤਘਨ ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਸੁਅਾੲਿ ਲੁਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Manamoukh Vadaa Akritaghanu Doojay Bhaai Suaai Loubhaaee.
translation: Manmukh, the mind-oriented, is very ungrateful and always likes to enjoy the sense of otherness.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰਜਨਹਾਰ ਨ ਚਿਤਿ ਵਸਾੲੀ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Sirajanahaar N Chiti Vasaaee ?23?
translation: He never cherishes that creator Lord in his heart.

gurmukhi: ੨੪ ਨਿਗੁਰਾ ਪ੍ਰਾਣੀ ਬੁਰਾ
translation: Man without Guru is the worst

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਗਭਣ ਜੀਅ ਜਾਣਦੀ ਪੁਤੁ ਸਪੁਤੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maan Gabhani Jeea Jaanadee Poutu Sapoutu Hovai Soukhadaaee.
translation: A pregnant mother feels that a comfort giving worthy son will be born by her.

gurmukhi: ਕਪੁਤਹੁਂ ਧੀ ਚੰਗੇਰੜੀ ਪਰ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਵਸਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Koupoutahu Dhee Changayrarhee Par Ghar Jaai Vasaai N Aaee.
translation: Better is a daughter than an unworthy son, she atleast would set up another' s home and would not come back (to put her mother to trouble).

gurmukhi: ਕੁਧੀਅਹੁਂ ਸਪ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਜਾੳੁ ਜਣੇਂਦੀ ਜਣਿ ਜਣਿ ਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dheeahu Sap Sakaaradaa Jaau Janayndee Jani Jani Khaaee.
translation: Than wicked daughter, a female snake is better who eats its progeny at its birth (so that more snakes will not be there to put others to harm).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਡਾੲਿਣ ਧੰਨ ਧੰਨ ਹੈ ਕਪਟੀ ਪੁਤੈ ਖਾੲਿ ਅਘਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maan Daain Dhannu Dhannu Hai Kapatee Poutai Khaai Aghaaee.
translation: Than female snake a witch is better who feels satiated after eating her treacherous son.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣ ਗਾੲੀ ਖਾੲਿ ਸਪ ਫੜਿ ਗੁਰਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਪਵਾੲਿ ਪਿੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baamhan Gaaee Khaai Sapu Dharhi Gur Mantr Pavaai Pirhaaee.
translation: Even a snake, the biter of brahmins and cows, listening to the mantra of the Guru would quietly sit in a basket.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਗੁਰੇ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਹੋਰੁ ਕੋ ਸਿਰਜਣਹਾਰੈ ਸਿਰਠਿ ੳੁਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Niguray Tuli N Horu Ko Sirajanahaarai Siratdi Oupaaee.
translation: But none is comparable(in wickedness) to a Guruless man in the whole universe created by the Creator.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਨ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Maataa Pitaa N Guru Saranaaee ?24?
translation: He never comes to the shelter of his parents or of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੨੫ ਨਿਗੁਰੇ ਦਾ ਦਰਸ਼ਨ ਬੁਰਾ ਹੈ
translation: Man without Guru is the worst

gurmukhi: ਨਿਗੁਰੇ ਲਖ ਨ ਤੁਲ ਤਿਸ ਨਿਗੁਰੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਿ ਨ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Niguray Lakhan Tul Tis Niguray Satigur Sarin N Aaay.
translation: He who comes not in the shelter of the Lord God is incomparable even with millions of persons without Guru.

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਪੈ ਅਾਪਣਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਡਿਠੇ ਨਿਗੁਰੇ ਸਰਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jo Gur Gopai Aapanaa Tisu Ditday Niguray Saramaaay.
translation: Even the Guruless people feel shy of seeing the man who talks ill of his Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਹ ਸੳੁਹਾਂ ਜਾਣਾ ਭਲਾ ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਸੳੁਹਾਂ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Seenh Sauhaan Jaanaa Bhalaa Naa Tisu Baymoukh Sauhaan Jaaay.
translation: It is better to face a lion than to meet that renegade man.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਜੋ ਮੁਹੁ ਫਿਰੈ ਤਿਸ ਮੁਹਿ ਲਗਣੁ ਵਡੀ ਬਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Tay Jo Muhu Dhirai Tisu Muhi Laganu Vadee Bulaaay.
translation: To deal with a person who turns away from the true Guru is to invite disaster.

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਤਿਸੁ ਮਾਰੈ ਧਰਮ ਹੈ ਮਾਰਿ ਨ ਹੰਘੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਹਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jay Tisu Maarai Dharam Hai Maari N Hanghai Aapu Hataaay.
translation: To kill such a person is a righteous act. If that cannot be done then one should oneself move away.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਅਾਮਿ ਧੋਹੀ ਅਕ੍ਰਿਤਘਣ ਬਾਮਣ ਗੳੂ ਵਿਸਾਹਿ ਮਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Suaami Dhrohee Akirataghanu Baaman Gaoo Visaahi Maraaay.
translation: Ungrateful person betrays his master and treacherously kills brahmins and cows.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਮੁਖ ਲੂੰਅ ਨ ਤੁਲਿ ਤੁਲਾੲੇ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Baymoukh Looa N Tuli Tulaai ?25?
translation: Such renegade is not. equal in value to one trichome.

gurmukhi: ੨੬ ਜੁਅਾਰੀੲੇ ਦਾ ਜਨਮ ਹਾਰਣਾ
translation: Wasting the life by the gambler

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨਸ ਦੇਹਿ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ਜੁਗਹ ਜੁਗੰਤਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ ਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Maanas Dayhi Dulabhu Hai Jougah Jougantari Aavai Vaaree.
translation: After many ages comes the turn of assuming the human body.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮ ਜਨਮੁ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ੲਿਕ ਵਾਕੀ ਕੋੜਮਾ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Outamu Janamu Dulabhu Hai Ik Vaakee Korhamaa Veechaaree.
translation: It is a rare boon to be born in a family of truthful and intelligent people.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਹਿ ਅਰੋਗ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ਭਾਗਠੁ ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਹਿਤਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Dayhi Arog Dulabhu Hai Bhaagatdu Maat Pitaa Hitakaaree.
translation: Almost rare to be healthy and to have beneficent and fortunate parents who can take care of the well-being of the child.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧੂ ਸੰਗਿ ਦੁਲੰਭੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਭਗਤਿ ਪਿਅਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saadhu Sangi Dulabhu Hai Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Bhagati Piaaree.
translation: Also rare is the holy congregation and loving devotion, the pleasure fruit of gurrnukhs.

gurmukhi: ਫਾਥਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਹਾਂ ਜਾਲਿ ਪੰਜ ਦੂਤ ਜਮਕਾਲ ਸੁ ਭਾਰੀ
transliteration: Dhaadaa Maaiaa Mahaan Jaali Panji Doot Jamakaalu Su Bhaaree.
translation: But the Jiv, caught in the web of five evil propensities bears the heavy punishment of Yama, the god of death.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਸਹਾ ਵਹੀਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਰ ਹਥਿ ਪਾਸਾ ਪੳੁਛਕਿ ਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Jiu Kari Sahaa Vaheer Vichi Par Hadi Paasaa Paouchhaki Saaree.
translation: The state of  jiv becomes the same as that of a hare caught in a crowd. The dice being in other's hand the whole game goes topsyturvy.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਕੁਦਾੲਿਅੜ ਜਮ ਜੰਦਾਰੁ ਸਾਰ ਸਿਰ ਮਾਰੀ
transliteration: Doojay Bhaai Kudaaiarhi Jam Jandaaru Saar Siri Maaree.
translation: The mace of Yama falls on the head of a jiv who gambles about in duality.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾੲੇ ਭਵਾੲੀਅੈ ਭਵਜਲੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਖੁਅਾਰੀ
transliteration: Aavai Jaai Bhavaaeeai Bhavajalu Andari Hoi Khuaaree.
translation: Such a creature entangled in the cycle of the transmigration goes on suffering disgrace in the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਰੈ ਜਨਮ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਜੁਅਾਰੀ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Haarai Janamu Amolu Juaaree ?26?
translation: Like a gambler he loses and wastes his precious life.

gurmukhi: ੨੭ ਚੳੁਪੜ ਦੀ ਖੇਲ ਵਾਙੂ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਪੁਗਦੇ ਹਨ
translation: Gurmukhs win as in a game of oblong dice

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹੁ ਜਗੁ ਚੳੁਪੜ ਖੇਲੁ ਹੈ ਅਾਵਾ ਗੳੁਣ ਭੳੁਜਲ ਸੈਂਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ihu Jagu Chaouparhi Khaylu Hai Aavaa Gaoun Bhaujal Sainsaaray.
translation: This world is a game of oblong dice and the creatures go on moving in and out of the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜੋੜਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਪੂਰਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Jorhaa Saadhasangi Pooraa Satigur Paari Outaaray.
translation: Gurmukhs join the association of the holy men and from there the perfect Guru (God) takes them across.

gurmukhi: ਲਗ ਜਾੲਿ ਸੋ ਪੁਗ ਜਾੲਿ ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦੀ ਪੰਜ ਨਿਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Lagi Jaai So Pougi Jaai Gur Parasaadee Panji Nivaaray.
translation: He who devotes his self to the Guru, becomes acceptable and the Guru dispels away his five evil propensities.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਅਾਪਹੁਂ ਬੁਰਾ ਨਾ ਕਿਸੈ ਵਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaau Hai Aapahoun Buraa N Kisai Vichaaray.
translation: The gurmukh remains in a state of spiritual calm and he never thinks ill of anybody.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਾਵਧਾਨ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਚਲੈ ਪਗੁ ਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Saavadhaan Guramoukhi Pand Chalai Pagu Dhaaray.
translation: Attuning consciousness with the Word, the gurmukhs alertly move with firm feet on the path of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਕ ਵੇਦ ਗੁਰੁ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਮਤਿ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਪਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Lok Vayd Guru Giaan Mati Bhaai Bhagati Guru Sikh Piaaray.
translation: Those Sikhs, dear to the Lord Guru, behave in accordance with morality, religious scriptures and the wisdom of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਵਸੈ ਗੁਰਦੁਅਾਰੇ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Nij Ghari Jaai Vasai Guru Duaaray ?27?
translation: Through the means of the Guru, they stabilize in their own self.

gurmukhi: ੨੮ ਅੰਨ੍ਹਾ ਅਾਗੂ
translation: If a blind becomes a leader

gurmukhi: ਵਾਂਸ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਨ ਹੋਵੲੀ ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਬਾਵਨ ਬੋਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Vaas Sougandhi N Hovaee Charanodak Baavan Bohaaay.
translation: Bamboo does not become fragrant but by the wash of Gum's feet, this also becomes possible.

gurmukhi: ਕਚਹੁਂ ਕੰਚਨ ਨਾ ਥੀਅੈ ਕਚਹੁਂ ਕੰਚਨ ਪਾਰਸ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kachahu Kanchan N Deeai Kachahoun Kanchan Paaras Laaay.
translation: Glass does not become gold but with the impact of philosopher's stone in the form of Guru, glass also transforms into gold.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਹਫਲ ਸਿੰਮੁਲ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਅਫਲ ਸਫਲ ਕਰਿ ਸਭ ਫਲ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Nihaphalu Sinmalu Jaaneeai Aphalu Saphalu Kari Sabh Phalu Paaay.
translation: Silk-cotton tree is supposed to be fruitless but that too (by the grace of Guru) becomes fruitful and gives all sorts of fruits.

gurmukhi: ਕਾੳੁਂ ਨ ਹੋਵਨਿ ੳੁਜਲੇ ਕਾਲੀ ਹੂੰ ਧੳੁਲੇ ਸਿਰਿ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kaaoun N Hovani Ujalay Kaalee Hoon Dhaulay Siri Aaay.
translation: However, manmukhs like crows never change into white from black even if their black hair become white i.e. they never leave their nature even in old age.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗ ਵੰਸ ਹੁੲਿ ਪਰਮਹੰਸ ਨਿਰਮੋਲਕੁ ਮੋਤੀ ਚੁਣਿ ਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kaagahu Hans Hui Dharam Hansu Niramolaku Motee Chouni Khaaay.
translation: But (by the grace of the Gum) the crow changes into swan and picks up invaluable pearls to eat.

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਪਰੋਤਹੁਂ ਦੇਵ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਕਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahoun Dayv Kari Saadh Sangati Guru Sabadi Kamaaay.
translation: The holy congregation transforming beasts and ghosts into gods, causes them to realize the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਸ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਾਰ ਨ ਜਾਤੀਅਾ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾੲਿ ਲੁਭਾੲੇ
transliteration: Tis Guru Saar N Jaateeaa Duramati Doojaa Bhaai Soubhaaay.
translation: Those wicked ones who are engrossed in the sense of duality have not known the glory of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਨ੍ਹਾ ਅਾਗੂ ਸਾਥ ਮੁਹਾੲੇ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Annaa Aagoo Saadu Muhaaay ?28?
translation: If the leader is blind, his companions are bound to be robbed of their belongings.

gurmukhi: ੨੯ ਨਿੰਮ੍ਰਤਾ ੳੁੱਤਮ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ਼
translation: Humility the best teaching

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਨ ਅਕਿਰਤਘਣੁ ਹੈ ਭਿ ਨ ਹੋਅਾ ਹੋਵਣਿਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Akiratighanu Hai Bhi N Hoaa Hovanihaaraa.
translation: Neither there is, nor there will be an ungrateful person like me.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਨ ਹਰਾਮਖੋਰੁ ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ ਅਵਗੁਣਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Haraamakhoru Horu N Koee Avagouniaaraa.
translation: None is there subsisting on evil means and a wicked person like me.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਨਿੰਦਕੁ ਨ ਕੋੲਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਸਿਰਿ ਬਜਰੁ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Nidaku N Koi Guru Nidaa Siri Bajaru Bhaaraa.
translation: No slanderer is there like me carrying on his head the heavy stone of the slander of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਬੇਮੁਖੁ ਨ ਕੋੲਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਤੇ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਹਤਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Baymoukhu N Koi Satiguru Tay Baymoukh Hatiaaraa.
translation: No one is a savage apostate like me turning away from the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਕੋ ਦੁਸਟ ਨਾਹਿ ਨਿਰਵੈਰੈ ਸਿੳੁ ਵੈਰ ਵਿਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Ko Dousat Naahi Niravairai Siu Vair Vikaaraa.
translation: None other is an evil person like me who has enmity with persons having no hostility.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਨ ਵਿਸਾਸ ਧ੍ਰੋਹਿ ਬਗਲ ਸਮਾਧੀ ਮੀਨ ਅਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Visaahu Dhrohu Bagal Samaadhee Meen Ahaaraa.
translation: No treacherous person equals me whose trance is like crane's who picks up fish for food.

gurmukhi: ਬਜਰ ਲੇਪ ਨ ੳੁਤਰੈ ਪਿੰਡ ਅਪਰਚੇ ਅੳੁਚਰਿ ਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bajaru Laypu N Outarai Pindu Aparachay Aouchari Chaaraa.
translation: My body, ignorant of Lord's name, eats inedibles and the layer of stony sins on it cannot be taken off.

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਜੇਹਾ ਨ ਦੁਬਾਜਰਾ ਤਜਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਹਿਤਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Doubaajaraa Taji Guramati Duramati Hitakaaraa.
translation: No bastard is like me who repudiating the wisdom of the Guru has deep attachment with wickedness.

gurmukhi: ਨਾੳੁਂ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਨ ਸਬਦ ਵੀਚਾਰਾ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Naau Mureed N Sabadi Veechaaraa ?29?
translation: Though my name is disciple,I have never reflected upon the Word (of the Guru).
Humility the best teaching

gurmukhi: ਬੇਮੁਖ ਹੋਵਨਿ ਬੇਮੁਖਾਂ ਮੈ ਜੇਹੇ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਮੁਖ ਡਿਠੇ
transliteration: Baymoukh Hovani Baymoukhaan Mai Jayhay Baymoukhi Moukhi Ditday.
translation: Seeing the face of an apostate like me, the apostates beome more deep -rooted apostates.

gurmukhi: ਬਜਰ ਪਾਪਾਂ ਬਜਰ ਪਾਪ ਮੈ ਜੇਹੇ ਕਰਿ ਵੈਰੀ ੲਿਠੇ
transliteration: Bajar Paapaan Bajar Paap Mai Jayhay Kari Vairee Itday.
translation: The worst sins have become my beloved ideals.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਠਾਂ ਬੇਮੁਖਾਂ ਅਾਪਹੁਂ ਬੁਰੇ ਜਾਣ ਕੈ ਸਿਠੇ
transliteration: Kari Kari Sitdaan Baymoukhaan Aapahoun Buray Jaani Kai Sitday.
translation: Considering them apostates I taunted them (though I am worse than them).

gurmukhi: ਲਿਖ ਨ ਸਕਨਿ ਚਿਤ੍ਰਗੁਪਤਿ ਸਤ ਸਮੁੰਦ ਸਮਾਵਨ ਚਿਠੇ
transliteration: Likh N Sakani Chitr Goupati Sat Samound Samaavani Chitday.
translation: The story of my sins cannot be written even by Yama's scribes because the record of my sins would fill the seven seas.

gurmukhi: ਚਿਠੀ ਹੂੰ ਤੂਮਾਰ ਲਿਖਿ ਲਖ ਲਖ ੲਿਕਦੂੰ ੲਿਕ ਦੁਧਿਠੇ
transliteration: Chitdee Hoon Toumaar Likhi Lakh Lakh Ikadoon Ik Dudhitday.
translation: My stories would get multiplied further into lacs each one doubly shameful than the other.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਂਗ ਹੁਰੇਹਿਅਾਂ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਸਕਰਾ ਸਭਾ ਸਭਿ ਠਿਠੇ
transliteration: Kari Kari Saang Hurayhiaan Hui Masakaraa Sabh Sabhi Ritday.
translation: So much I have mimed others so often that all buffoons feel ashamed before me.

gurmukhi: ਮੈਥਹੁਂ ਬੁਰਾ ਨ ਕੋੲਿ ਸਰਿਠੇ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Maidahu Buraa N Koee Saritday ?30?
translation: None is worse than me in the whole creation.

gurmukhi: ੩੧ ਗੁਰੂ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਦਾ ਕੁੱਤਾ
translation: A dog of the Guru's court

gurmukhi: ਲੈਲੀ ਦੀ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਦਾ ਕੁਤਾ ਮਜਨੂੰ ਦੇਖਿ ਲੁਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Lailay Dee Daragaah Daa Koutaa Majanoon Daykhi Loubhaanaa.
translation: Beholding the dog of Laild's house, Majana was charmed.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤੇ ਦੀ ਪੈਰੀਂ ਪਵੈ ਹੜਿ ਹੜਿ ਹਸੈ ਲੋਕ ਵਿਡਾਣਾ
transliteration: Koutay Dee Pairee Pavai Harhi Harhi Hasai Lok Vidaanaa.
translation: He fell at the feet of dog seeing which people laughed roaringly.

gurmukhi: ਮੀਰਾਸੀ ਮੀਰਾਸੀਅਾਂ ਨਾਮ ਧਰੀਕੁ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਬਿਬਾਣਾ
transliteration: Meeraasee Meeraaseeaan Naam Dhareeku Mureedu Bibaanaa.
translation: Out of (Muslim) bards one bard became disciple of Baia (Nanak).

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤਾ ਡੂਮ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਕੁਤਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਕੁਤਿਅਾਂ ਨਿਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Koutaa Doom Vakhaaneeai Koutaa Vichi Koutiaan Nimaanaa.
translation: His companions called him a dog-bard, even among dogs a lowly one.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਅਾਸਕ ਸਬਦ ਦੇ ਕੁਤੇ ਦਾ ਪੜਕੁਤਾ ਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Aasaku Sabad Day Koutay Daa Parhakoutaa Bhaanaa.
translation: TheSikhs of the Guru who were suitors of the Word (the Brhm) took a fancy to that so-called dog of dogs.

gurmukhi: ਕਟਨਿ ਚਟਨਿ ਕੁਤਿਅਾਂ ਮੋਹੁ ਨ ਧੋਹੁ ਧ੍ਰਿਗਸਤ ਕਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Katanu Chatanu Koutiaan Mohu N Dhohu Dhrigasatu Kamaanaa.
translation: Biting and licking is the nature of dogs but they have no infatuation, treachery or cursedness.

gurmukhi: ਅਵਗੁਣਿਅਾਰੇ ਗੁਣੁ ਕਰਨਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕੁਰਬਾਣਾ
transliteration: Avagouniaaray Gounu Karani Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Kurabaanaa.
translation: The gurmukhs are sacrifice unto the holy congregation because it is benevolent even to the evil and wicked persons.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਵਖਾਣਾ ||੩੧||੩੭||
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Vakhaanaa ?31?37?saintee?
translation: Holy congregation is known for its reputation as uplifter of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਬੇਲ ਹੁੲਿ ਚੰਬੇਲੀ ਗਤਿ ਮੂਲ ਸਾਖਾ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਬਿਬਿਧ ਬਿਥਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pooran Braham Gur Bayl Hui Chanbaylee Gati , Mool Saakhaa Patr Kari Bibidh Bidaar Hai ?
translation: Satguru, manifestation of Almighty God, is like jasmine creeper of which He Himself is the root and all His devotees and pious persons are its leaves and branches.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪੁਹਪ ਸੁਬਾਸ ਨਿਜ ਰੂਪ ਤਾ ਮੈ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਹੁੲਿ ਕਰਤ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਕੋ ੳੁਧਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gursikh Puhap Soubaas Nij Roop Taa Mai , Pragat Hui Karat Sansaar Ko Udhaar Hai ?
translation: Pleased at the services of His devotees (like Bhai Lehna Ji, Baba Amar Das Ji, etc.) Satguru turns those devotees by His grace and makes them into fragrance-spreading flowers and by manifesting in them is liberating the world.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਲ ਮਿਲਿ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਸੁਬਾਸ ਕੋ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਪਾ ਖੋੲਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਹੈ ਫੁਲੇਲ ਮਹਕਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Til Mili Baasanaa Soubaas Ko Nivaas Kari , Aapaa Khoi Hoi Hai Dhulayl Mahakaar Hai ?
translation: Just as sesame seed loses its existence and becomes scent when unites with the fragrance of the flowers, the devotees too lose themselves to the Lord through meditation and spread divine fragrance in the world.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗ ਮੈ ਪਤਿਤ ਪੁਨੀਤ ਰੀਤਿ ਸੰਸਾਰੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਹੈ ||੩੭||
transliteration: Gurmukhi Maarag Mai Patit Pouneet Reeti , Sansaaree Hui Nirankaaree Paraoupakaar Hai ?37?
translation: Sikhism has a tradition of changing sinners into holy persons. And in this path, this is a very righteous task and service towards others. Those engrossed in material world are converted into God-loving and godly persons. They are detached from maya (mamm
